page.title: 15Cotton Abbots Farm Waverton
page.content: Three generations of the present farmers family have farmed this land since 1875.It is the biggest farm in the district and is part of the huge Westminster Estate.It is primarily a Dairy Farm with 300 Friesian cows,but also produces arable crops including sugar beet,peas,barley and wheat.The wheat crop is sprayed to prevent mildew,and modern growing techniques result in a yield of 3 or more tonnes per acre.One field produces hay for feeding calves ,but most of the feed in winter is silage. 2.800tonnes are cut and stored each year.There are also 80 beef cattle. Milking is at 4.30 a.m. and 2.30p.m. In 1930 it took 14 men to lok after 140 cows.In 1985 6 men look after 300.The improvements in technology that have taken place has meant that the milk yield has doubled over this same period.
